metadata.title: CVE-2018-12116 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0 and 8.14.0: HTTP requestsplitting: If Node.js can be convinced to use unsanitized user-providedUnicode data for the `path` option of an HTTP request, then data can beprovided which will trigger a second, unexpected, and user-defined HTTPrequest to made to the same server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
